data.title: some kind of try finally (or except) block for gdscript
data.body:
In Python is called try except in Java try catch finally. Run the code inside try block if it fails run the finally block instead. This can greatly  simplify  coding in gd script by removing all crashes. You will no longer have to worry about bad code. Sometimes you may want to have 1 code working on a dynamic piece of data and not have to build extra failsafes in case say no data is there. 

ALL errors from a failed try block will always show up in debug  window anyway (automatic catch) so even if you don't have to worry you can still see your code is bad.

try 
...  code here
finally
...  code here

data.title: External module, function with more than 5 parameters
data.body:
I'm trying to create an external module and I have functions that take more than 5 parameters and get compilation errors. If i reduce the number of parameters to max 5 the code compiles ok.

Example:

``` c++
int send_event(int slot, int num, int pos, int vel, int mod, int ctl, int val); // compilation error
int send_event(int slot, int num, int pos, int vel, int mod); // compilation OK!
```

The error seem to indicate that there is no suitable template: "e:\godot-2.0-beta\core\object_type_db.h(337): error C2784: 'MethodBind _create_method_bind(R (__thiscall T::_ )(P1,P2,P3,P4,P5) const)' : could not deduce template argument for 'R (__thiscall T::\* )(P1,P2,P3,P4,P5) const' from 'int (__thiscall myModule::\* )(int,int,int,int,int,int,int)'"

Is the number of parameters limited to 5?

Would it be possible to extend the limit to a higher number, or remove the limit?

data.title: 3dSprite invisible in editor/game if not rotated & billboard y still broken
data.body:
3DSprites behave strangely . They seem to be invisible by default until you rotate it 90 degrees then they become visible. editor only!

Billboard fix y property still broken both in code and in the editor interface.  

Also I get strange octant face null issues if  try to translate a 3DSprite (with billboard property on?).  

When 2 or more 3DSprites with same dimensions and billboard on are at the same position (ye on top of one another) the draw Z order is based on the order in the node list. However! When the game begins the top most sprite is drawn then only after 2 second delay all other sprites are drawn as well. It seems like the visual engine rushes to draw the scene but forgets to draw ALL the billboard sprites save the top most one right away. it may be same without billboard. 

See #1366 & #2061

data.title: The settings directory path should be platform-dependant (XDG_CONFIG_HOME)
External module issues with const char*
Undo/Redo per scene
data.body: Undo and redo would be much more useful if they worked per scene rather than globally. Currently, switching scenes is itself an undo action, which is rarely helpful, especially when working on multiple scenes at once.

don't install libevdev-dev for travis build
data.body: Don't need that anymore, as the dependancy on it has been removed.

data.title: Flipped environment background texture when using viewport + render tex or viewport stretch display mode
data.body:
Here's a simple scene that is setup to show the issue: 
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/3292249/flipped_texture_env_BG.zip

Run the scene first and you'll see the texture is the correct way up

Now go to project settings > Display and set stretch_mode to 'viewport'

Now run the scene again and you'll see that the texture is flipped vertically

This is probably related to the same issue that caused  #2180

data.title: ResourceInteractiveLoaderText::get_stage() doesn't work
data.body:
`ResourceInteractiveLoaderText::resource_current` is never initialized or incremented

Also, `get_stage_count()` has a comment `//+ext_resources;`, I guess currently it only checks internal resources

data.title: Child nodes of a viewport node are not selectable
data.body: I can't tell since when, but objects that are children of a Viewport cannot seem to be selected, highlighted or movable in the editor. For example, adding a Camera2D will be practically invisible, and Sprite2D will be seen but they won't get their resize/move boxes. They work as before in-game, though, and this is only editor behavior.

data.title: move along
data.body: nope

data.title: CollisionShape2D not work in tilemap
data.body:
Hi all,

I have encountered a weird bug when I am using a sprite with collision shape in a tile set.

The node tree is Node2D -> Sprite -> StaticBody2D -> CollisionShape2D, **and the sprite and collision shape's offsets are modified**, as the following screenshot shows.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1430376/12662126/176755a2-c659-11e5-81ae-cee4ec4d10f1.png)

Then I convert the scene to a tile set and use this tile in a tile map, the collision shape just goes to a wrong position when I play it.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1430376/12662210/b87393d4-c659-11e5-9667-7e19714856d0.png)

And in this situation, the debug option "visible collision shapes" won't show the collision shape, even at a wrong position.

data.title: Added delimiter to File.get_csv_line
data.body:
Allows you to choose which delimiter to use for splitting the line.
See #3495

data.title: Show joystick axis names for InputMap actions
data.body:
Joystick buttons have these little helper strings in the InputMap actions,  like `"XBOX A, PS X,..."`.
I think the same should also be done for joystick axes, as it might not be obvious for new users which index to choose.

Also related to this: why can you choose between 11 axes? I think we officially only support 7

![too_many_axes.png](http://i65.tinypic.com/2iup7h3_th.png)

data.title: fix dpad left/right not showing correctly in project settings
data.body:
The condition relied on the magic number `14`  instead of `16/JOY_BUTTON_MAX`, causing the code not to run for the last two buttons.

![dpad-inputmap.png](http://oi67.tinypic.com/2a5abyg.jpg)

data.title: debugger video mem section works only after refresh
data.body:
![screenshot from 2016-01-28 17-59-33](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6195060/12651099/e289600c-c5ed-11e5-9c53-5421b0daff8b.png)
Not sure if a bug but I set a break point and went to the video mem section to find it empty. I have to hit the refresh button for it to work.
Maybe have it refreshed automatically on breakpoints?

data.title: FileSystem panel resets view mode when opening a new scene
data.body:
this is only a little glitch but could be annoying.
If you set the FileSystem panel to show files as a list, when you load a scene from disk, the panel will switch back to icons view mode.

data.title: File.get_csv_line() should accept custom delimiter
data.body: I can't use this nice function now, because it's fixed comma delimiter. It would be nice if it could be called with a delimiter given like File.get_csv_line(";") in my case.

data.title: add feature to exclude files from export
data.body: This adds "filters to exclude from export" option in "Project Export Settings" in the "Resources" tab.

data.title: x11: use different strings for WM_CLASS depending on context
data.body:
Fixes #766, enables the use of custom window rules for tiling WMs. (eg. run editor maximized, and games floating/centered)

Sets the resource name in the WM_CLASS property to:
- "Godot" for game windows (same as before)
- "Godot_Editor" for the editor
- "Godot_ProjectList" for the project manager

data.title: ColorPicker defaults to red and loses focus when dragging mouse out of the canvas
data.body:
As the title says. It actually happens only on the left and bottom sides, i.e. `local_mouse_pos.x<0` and `local_mouse_pos.y>height`.

It's quite annoying as the previous position in the colour scale is lost, and the focus is somehow lost too so you can't click on the color scale to adjust it, you need first to click in the main canvas, and only then you can change the colour "scale" (or ladder or specter or however it's named, the part on the right :p).

It should behave as for dragging on the top and right sides: the picker cursor stays on the edge and moves to match either the x or y mouse coordinate.

data.title: closing and re-opening a scene crashes the editor
data.body:
Here the test case: http://ffxrunner2.ffx.it/godot_testcases/viewport_testcase.zip
The project opens a scene named test.scn, try to close it and reopen it a few times, the editor will crash.
I believe it is related somehow to Viewport node.

data.title: API reference lacks descriptions for many methods, constants, signals, etc.
data.body:
_Docteam edit (by @akien-mga): Hijacking the original issue to make it a general topic about missing API doc._

The incomplete API reference is a known issue and improving it is a work in progress.
You are very welcome to help by proposing pull requests on the XML reference in `doc/base/classes.xml`.

See http://www.godotengine.org/article/fill-blank-class-reference for more information and https://etherpad.net/p/godot-classref-status for a list of what documentation writers are currently working on.

Also don't hesitate to come on #godotengine-devel on Freenode IRC, as writing method descriptions often requires diving into the source code, so better do it surrounded by fellow code lurkers :)

---

_Initial OP message:_

I found missing doc's for "void free()" and "get_method_list()" in Object
